tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I visited him about 4 times so far. Weekday visits were good, details & no unnecessary medication. Minimum with long term resolutions and avoid getting sick again and again & it worked. Yes i was surprised too that recommended lifestyle changes fixed by fever issues even when i was scared. Good thing is that he usually prescribe things in a way that you don't have to revisit.

On another note, avoid visiting him on weekend. Its badly packed. His schedule is extremely tight and you might not get a good outcome. He wont see things properly and will be usually in hurry to clear patients as thr is usually an extremely long queue & absolutely no walk-ins allowed.

My experience on general medicine has been good so far and never visited on anything higher so for that you need someone else's feedback.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Dr. Manohar K N has been treating myself and my wife for Diabetes for last 8 years.  Doctor has been prescribing latest medicine which suits us.  Just to narrate an incident.  I took my medicines to South Africa as I need to travel for project assignment.  When I visited one of Physician for flu and cold. I was asked what medicine do I use for my Diabetes.   When I showed the medicines I was using, the South Africa Physician said the prescribed medicines were latest available in the market and are very good.  I was very happy to hear that the Dr Manohar uses all the knowledge he acquired from various seminars and workshop. He has also treated my parents and has been treating my wife and my mother in law.  I also appreciate the Dr. Manohar for his social awareness and giving back to the society.  Keep up the good work sir. 

Thanks 
 -  Krishna Mohan Kappagantu Practice Manager and Senior Consultant, HCL Axon Pty, South Africa.

tags: None
review:
************ He prescribed an antibiotic Cefpodoxime not in the list of sensitive drugs in culture report, knowing that it's a critical case of post operation UTI and infection can spread to the site of surgery quickly if not treated early. Even on asking how he arrived at the drug, he says it's better than Cefatoxime marked sensitive on the report. It is never a game of better among things not even tested on the report. 

Turns out both are third generation cephalosporins, and it doesn't make sense to prescribe one not tested sensitive in the report. Another two third generation cephalosporins were tested resistant in the report, Ceftadizime and Ceftriaxone. It was risky to prescribe an untested antibiotic.

tags: None
review:
He will not listen what all problem you are getting. for me i told i have migrain, then he told okay classic migrain, have this medicine and come back to me atfer 1 month.

he does not have patience to listen to the patient and i felt like just kidding with my problem. consultation is very expensive and they don't listen to your problem properly.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
If kindness is a virtue Dr.Manohar KN has plenty of it. I was admitted into Manipal Hospital under exceptional conditions with a rather challenging medical situation. The medical case was complex because to start with I was immue suppressed, then had a false covid positive report, which was immediately followed with back to back negative reports however with low WBC and platelets. It took a few days for the WBC to come up. I am thankful to Dr. Manohar for the various matters, some of them being; 
1.	My family doctor who is a senior Endocrinologist coordinated with Dr.Manohar for my treatment, he was kind enough and obliged to keep him in the loop seamlessly. 
2.	Dr.Manohar often had my lab results at the tip of his fingers and compared the numbers with ease. 
3.	With his PPE and with seven days of continuous stint with covid patients, he was kind and gave me a patient hearing and also discussed the immediate next plans. 
4.	I am an experienced patient and with that I say, he handled my matter with utmost authority on the subject and with care. 
I am highly grateful to him to have supported my case in this very difficult covid situation.  
Regards
Shruthi

tags: None
review: For different problems, I am consulting him for almost a year now. With his thoughtful advice, the treatment has been satisfied every time. Even the schedule has not been bothersome. The waiting time has never exceeded 15 minutes. Everything is perfect and I am well satisfied with the so far experience.

tags: None
review: It was in fact, his leisure time when I reached the hospital. But he still stayed for me and recommended for the required Xray. Later he was available on Whatsapp to review the reports and guided me **** *** **** ********** Even though it was for the first time I consulted him, my husband had been to him before. He has been our best consultant so far. We are satisfied with the treatment again.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,Value for money,
review:
Really appreciate the diagnosis ...its just perfect i went for a complaint with High BP and it was handled quite well and found the root cause and for headache and snoring problem  he suggested to undergo sleep apnea test never expected...that ...and dcotor was right ...
.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: We (whole family) are his patients since last 10 years & consider him as one of the best General Physician in Bangalore I have ever met in my life, he is good in analyzing & diagnosing the issues & will explain you very well, secondly he will never prescribe any medicines unnecessarily, similarly for any tests too. In a nut shell I would define him as "Superb Doctor" because you can consult him to any health issues.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
I visited the doctor on 24/03/2018, In the first place the doctor was not friendly at all and dint even ask me to sit when i went into his room and was busy looking at his mobile. 
Later when i started explaning my problem he just took less than 2 mins to identify my issue and  asked me to take dolo 650 for 4 times /day. 
When the nurse checked my BP it was 100/140 and the doctor never bothered to ask the reason and just ignored it. I literelly fainted on my way back home. Very bad service. Not worth paying Rs.650 for 2 mins consultation.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,
review: I couldn't expect such a response from such a reputed doctor. I visited today with my mother to this doctor for a High BP problem which she has been facing since long. This person was quite busy with his stuffs and not bother of listening carefully as what i am telling to him. At the end he could not even give me a reason as why this might be happening and instead he said he would try a medicine to see if that works. And then finally he prescribed a medicine. He wrote a medicine and even didn't mention the power of the medicine. Now what power medicine am I supposed to buy? So should i go 40 kms (as i do not have his contact details) and ask him to mention the power or he should have mentioned it at that time itself? **** ***** *** **** ** *** ********* **** ****** *** ***** ** * **** ******* *** *** **** ** ** ******* **** ** *** ******** *** *** **** **** I paid and visited with some hope not to get such responses. Will surely never recommend to anyone.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: *** ******* * * ** *** ** *** **** ****** * **** ********* **** ** ********** my entire family go for consultation to him. A perfect quality treatment. A great human being, humble, kind. My mom suffering from diabetic since 15 years, now she is being treated by Manohar sir since 7 years, She is in West Bengal getting her regular sugar checked as instructed by him and every time I show it to Manohar sir, he gives the instructions and changes the medication if required without any consultation fees.

review: Excellent crisp treatments. Emphasise on lifestyle changes more than medicine   very knowledgeable and intelligent with many qualifications and accolades at young age. Preventive aspects are well explained

tags: None
review: My wife suffered high fever, chills, cough, severe boby pain. She was 22 weeks pregnant and fever during pregnancy could be dangerous. Dr.Manohar suspected it to be H1N1 which was later confirmed through swab test. He had spoken in an assuring manner and treated her well. Within a week, she was cured and the baby is safe too. Thanks for Dr. Manohar's timely help.

It was a pleasure getting treated under you at my stages of ill health. I wish the best of everything to you.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review:
My experience with Dr. K N Manohar has been really very good. I had taken my father in law to him for a check up. 
He brought a lot of clarity to our understanding of diabetes and also suggested ways for a better management. His tips on life style changes with respect to exercises, diet and the drugs have all helped my father in law in keeping his sugars under check. 
I would recommend him to all my friends and relatives.
